cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 975 miles east-southeast of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest to northwest toward the North Carolina and northern South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina coast, around Cape Fear

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to the NC/VA border, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of South Carolina and North Carolina, with effects extending into Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Only a 5% cumulative chance of reaching tropical-storm force (34 kt) over the next five days; sustained strong winds are unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large swells and rip-currents possible; significant storm-surge (>3 ft) not expected along the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Peripheral rain bands could bring light to moderate rain late week, but heavy rainfall totals (>4 in) are not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents impacting coastal operations and small-craft activity.
